me.kiip.sdk
Class Kiip

java.lang.Object
  me.kiip.sdk.Kiip

public abstract class Kiip
extends java.lang.Object

Kiip is an implementation to interface between your application and the Kiip service.

Author:
Grantland Chew

Nested Class Summary
static interface Kiip.Callback
          Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when an asynchronous task completes.

          Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when a user is to be given in-game content.

          Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when a promo is returned.
static interface Kiip.OnSwarmListener
          Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when a user joins a swarm.

setCapabilities

public abstract void setCapabilities(java.lang.String[] capabilities)
Manually overrides the capabilities of the application. *THIS SHOULD ONLY BE USED BY WRAPPERS* This must be called after setting any listeners (setOnSwarmListener, setOnContentListener, etc.) Supported capabilities: Kiip.CAPABILITY_REAL, Kiip.CAPABILITY_VIRTUAL, Kiip.CAPABILITY_SWARM

Parameters:
capabilities -

startSession

public abstract boolean startSession(Kiip.Callback callback)
Starts a new session. This should be called in every Activity#onStart method. Session handling works by keeping track of the Activity stack in your Application to monitor sessions. Kiip#startSession is a +1 and Kiip#endSession is a -1 to the stack. Once the stack size reaches 0, a 10 second timer is fired. If another startSession isn't called within that timer, the session is declared as ended. Every Kiip#startSession MUST be accompanied by a matching Kiip#endSession.

Parameters:
callback - The callback that will be executed after the request completes.
Returns:
True if the session is truly starting.

endSession

public abstract boolean endSession(Kiip.Callback callback)
Ends the current session. This should be called in every Activity#onStop method. Session handling works by keeping track of the Activity stack in your Application to monitor sessions. Kiip#startSession is a +1 and Kiip#endSession is a -1 to the stack. Once the stack size reaches 0, a 10 second timer is fired. If another startSession isn't called within that timer, the session is declared as ended. Every Kiip#startSession MUST be accompanied by a matching Kiip#endSession.

Parameters:
callback - The callback that will be executed after the request completes.
Returns:
True if the session is truly ending.

getPromo

public abstract void getPromo(android.content.Context context,
                              Kiip.OnPromoListener listener)
Get a promo. Will return a valid promo if available, null otherwise.

Parameters:
context - The context in which the promo will be shown.
listener - The callback that will be executed either after a promo is found or after the list of promos is searched and no promos are valid.
